project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management. The app displays a text with an icon, and toggles between 'Cat' with a clock icon and 'Dog' with a person icon upon clicking the text.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modularized approach, with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. The Cubit pattern is used for state management, ensuring a clear separation of concerns and maintainability.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. Sets up the BlocProvider and initializes the HomeScreen.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: Clicks on text
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: Change state
AnimalState -> HomeScreen: Notify state change
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: Update widget
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit manages the state of the animal (Cat or Dog). When the user clicks on the text, the AnimalCubit toggles the state, which triggers a rebuild of the AnimalText widget.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which displays the AnimalText widget. The navigation structure is straightforward with no additional screens or navigation.
